args.natural_language_statement: Translate: Let G be a group with the property that the only subgroups of G are the trivial subgroup and G itself (i.e., G has no nontrivial proper subgroups). Prove that G is cyclic of prime order: there exists a prime p and an element g : G such that G = ⟨g⟩ and |G| = p. End the Lean statement with := by sorry. Import Mathlib at the top.

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Subgroup

theorem Herstein_exercise_2_3_16 {G : Type _} [Group G]
  (h : ∀ H : Subgroup G, H = (⊥ : Subgroup G) ∨ H = (⊤ : Subgroup G)) :
  ∃ p : ℕ, Nat.Prime p ∧ ∃ g : G, Subgroup.closure (Set.singleton g) = (⊤ : Subgroup G) ∧ (Fintype G ∧ Fintype.card G = p) := by sorry
